nodes.text: It is also undisputed in the scientific/biological community that the point of conception is the commencement of the biological life of a member of it's species. In other words, the biological life of a homo sapien begins when the sperm fertilizes the egg and the newly created zygote begins to reproduce cells.

You do realise that by your definition, identical twins are the same 'life'? You do also realise that a freshly fertilised egg does not meet the standard criteria for judging whether something is alive?
No - standard scientific criteria for life.
And what is this 'standard scientific criteria for life' that a zygote does not meet?
